result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J. Orlowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle J Orlowski in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF194, 13CF215, 13CF350, 14CF67

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Isherwood provides written statements of the victims grandparents. 
Court reviews those statements. 

Atty Isherwood indicates 14CF67 would be dismissed and read-in today. 
Atty Lueschow concurs. 
BY THE COURT: 14CF67 is dismissed and read- in. 

Atty Isherwood makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lueschow makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
13CF350 Count 2 - 
Imposed & Stayed - 9 months jail, Granted credit for 46 days. 
Placed on probation for 3 years: 

13CF350 Count 3: 
Imposed & Stayed - 9 months jail, concurrent with Count 2. 
Placed on probation for 3 years: 

13CF350 Count 6:
Imposed & Stayed: 9 months jail, concurrent with Count 2 & 3.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 

Conditions of Probation:
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and sign releases so agent can discuss the case and review the assessment and monitor compliance with treatment plan.  Will allow agent to accept current assessment if agent deems appropriate. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Not consume alcohol whatsoever. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances, illegal drugs or alcohol unlawfully. 
Maintain an approved authorization of release of information for all mental health, physicians and pharmacies. 
Use one (1) pharmacy.
Provide releases to probation agent. 
Comply with a psychological evaluation and follow the treatment recommendations. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment.  Court will allow school fulltime after he has paid the restitution in full. 
Pay restitution in the amount of $800.26 to David and Lola Becker.
After restitution is paid, obtain GED or high school equivalency. 
Maintain an alcohol and drug free living environment.  No alcohol in his home. 
Pay supervision fees as directed by the agent. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
No contact with Kortnee Schied, her residence or place of employment, her mother or her grandparents and their residences or places of employment. 
Complete Domestic Abuse Alternative Program if agent deems appropriate.  If agent doesn't feel it is required, then will need to complete the Anger Management Program. 
Perform 40 hours community service.  Should preferrably be done thru the Portage County Parks Department during probation.  
Required to perform atleast 20 hours in his first year of supervision. 
Write letters of apology to Kortnee Schied and that is to be provided to agent to forward if appropriate. 
Write letter of appreciation to his mother and provide that to his agent.
Pay costs.  To be paid during the term of probation. 

13CF194 Count 2 -
Imposed & Stayed - 30 days jail, consecutive to 13CF350.  1 day credit. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent with 13CF350:
Comply with conditions of probation in 13CF350.
Pay costs during term of probation. 

13CF215 Count 2 -
Imposed & Stayed - 30 days jail, consecutive to 13CF194 & 13CF350.   
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent with 13CF194 & 13CF350:
Comply with conditions of probation in 13CF350.
Pay costs during term of probation. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond in all files is to be applied to restitution/fine/costs.
Plea hearing on May 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle J. Orlowski
Current: 5301 Bees Lane, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2014)
Prior: 530 Bees Lane, Plover, WI 54467 United States
Pre-trial conference on April 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Arraignment:
State files Information.  Waived reading of Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered
Bond Continued.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:25 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
 Attorney files written waiver of Preliminary hearing.
 Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.

Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over.

Bond Continued
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle J. Orlowski
Current: 530 Bees Lane, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 02-24-2014)
Prior: Portage County Jail 1500 Strongs Ave., Stevens Point, WI 54481
Initial appearance on February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bond is amended from $5,000 cash to $500 cash. 
Bond is identical to all bonds that were previously ordered.  
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week.
No contact of any kind, direct or indirect, with the victim.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski appeared by video. Attorney Karen Lueschow in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Lueschow makes statements regarding reduction in bond.  Requests a signature bond. 
Court reviewed the files on Friday. 
Court questions Atty Lueschow.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bond is identical to all bonds that were previously ordered.

Defendant Kyle J Orlowski in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF194, 13CF215, 13CF350

Atty Isherwood makes statements to the Court.  In reviewing the file to prepare for sentencing, it has come to her attention that he has missed day reports.   Asks that Security take the defendant into custody for felony bail jumping charges.  Asks the sentencing hearing be rescheduled. 
Atty Lueschow asks for a bond hearing to be held and the defendant allowed to turn himself in. 
Atty Isherwood indicates she does not have the paperwork to proceed to a bond hearing. 
Court questions Atty Isherwood. 
Atty Isherwood received the report from Day Report prior that she received yesterday. 
Atty Lueschow makes statements.  Defendant was unaware that he need to day report every day upon his release from jail. 
Court reviews the bond in 13CF194. 


BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for the defendant's arrest.  
Bond is set in the amount of $5,000 cash. 
Bond is identical to all bonds that were previously ordered.  
The bond revocation will be heard on Monday as well for these 3 files. 
Court apologizes to the victims/representatives that are present in the Courtroom. 

Parties meet with the Court to re-schedule sentencing.
